event.headline_as_text: "Could It Be Magic" - Barry Manilow Performs at HP Pavilion
event.headline_as_html: "Could It Be Magic" - Barry Manilow Performs at HP Pavilion
event.summary_as_text: Returning to San Jose, silky pop crooner Barry Manilow performs in concert at HP Pavilion. The evening will be highlighted by the legendary entertainer's hits including "Mandy," "I Write the Songs" and "Copacabana (At the Copa)." Manilow's storied career includes Grammy, Tony and Emmy wins, sales of more than 80 million records, 25 consecutive Top 40 hits, and induction into the Songwriter's Hall of Fame. Manilow has hit the road once again after ending his Las Vegas residency in December 2011, and this will be his only Northern California appearance on this latest tour.

event.headline_as_text: Mark Morris' "The Hard Nut": Beloved Retro-Modern Take on "The Nutcracker"
event.headline_as_html: Mark Morris' The Hard Nut: Beloved Retro-Modern Take on The Nutcracker
event.summary_as_text: A Bay Area holiday favorite, Mark Morris' "The Hard Nut" is back with its retro-modern take on the beloved "Nutcracker" tale, complete with dancing snowflakes, waltzing flowers and a hilariously skewed family holiday party. Voted Best "Nutcracker" three years in a row in Ovation TV's "Battle of the Nutcrackers", this energetic and delightful production has been called a "sublime marriage of wit, music, and movement" ("San Francisco Chronicle"), and "something approaching a miracle" ("The Washington Post"). Enchanting audiences for more than 20 years, this seasonal favorite features Tchaikovsky's "Nutcracker" score performed by the Piedmont East Bay Children's Choir and Berkeley Symphony Orchestra..

Enchanting audiences for more than 20 years, this seasonal favorite features Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker score performed by the Piedmont East Bay Children's Choir and Berkeley Symphony Orchestra..

event.headline_as_text: Alameda Civic Ballet's "The Nutcracker", a Holiday Family Favorite
event.headline_as_html: Alameda Civic Ballet's The Nutcracker, a Holiday Family Favorite
event.summary_as_text: This year, special guest stars Ethan and Nikki White, finalists in Paula Abdul's "Live to Dance" join a cast of more than 100 dancers -- ranging in age from 3 to 60 to bring "The Nutcracker" to life. The Whites will play the Snow King and Queen as well as the Arabian dancers in Alameda Civic Ballet's eighth annual production of the magical holiday ballet. Set to Tchaikovsky's timeless score, the audience follows young Clara and her Nutcracker prince on a Christmas night journey that begins with an epic battle against the Mouse King, through the Land of the Snowflakes to the Kingdom of Sweets, ruled by the enchanting Sugar Plum Fairy.
